@description.name: @description
@description.body: Base class for dialog widgets

@description.name: @description
@description.body: for backwards-compability

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Enforce the use of a coloured blocker. Added for backwards-compability with pre-1.2 versions

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a dialog instance by type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} The dialog type to get
@param.description: The dialog type to get

@param.name: @param

@param.body: context {Object?} The context to use with the callback function
@param.description: The context to use with the callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: caption {String?} The caption of the dialog window
@param.description: The caption of the dialog window

@description.name: @description

@param.name: @param

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object} The context to use with the callback function
@param.description: The context to use with the callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {String} The default value of the prompt textfield
@param.description: The default value of the prompt textfield

@param.name: @param
@param.body: caption {String?} The caption of the dialog window
@param.description: The caption of the dialog window

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Shortcut for select dialog

@param.name: @param
@param.description: The message to display

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Array?} Options to select from. If omitted, "Yes" (true) or "No" (false) will be used.
@param.description: Options to select from. If omitted, "Yes" (true) or "No" (false) will be used.

@param.name: @param
@param.description: The callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object?} The context to use with the callback function
@param.description: The context to use with the callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: allowCancel {Boolean?} Default: true. If the cancel button is pressed, the result value will be undefined.
@param.description: Default: true. If the cancel button is pressed, the result value will be undefined.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: caption {String?} The caption of the dialog window
@param.description: The caption of the dialog window

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Shortcut for form dialog. Cannot be reused.

@param.name: @param
@param.description: The message to display

@param.name: @param
@param.body: formData {Map} Map of form data. See {@link qxl.dialog.Form.formData}
@param.description: Map of form data. See {@link qxl.dialog.Form.formData}

@param.name: @param
@param.description: The callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object?} The context to use with the callback function
@param.description: The context to use with the callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: caption {String?} The caption of the dialog window
@param.description: The caption of the dialog window

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Constructor

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
properties {Map|String|undefined} If you supply a map, all the
 corresponding properties will be set. If a string is given, use it
 as to set the 'message' property.
@param.description:
If you supply a map, all the
 corresponding properties will be set. If a string is given, use it
 as to set the 'message' property.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the dialog is shown. If true, call the show() method. If false, call the hide() method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to block the ui while the widget is displayed

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The blocker's color

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The blocker's opacity

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Callback function that will be called when the user has interacted with the widget. See sample callback method supplied in the source code of each dialog widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The context for the callback function

@description.name: @description
@description.body: A banner image/logo that is displayed on the widget, if applicable

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The message that is displayed

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to allow cancelling the dialog

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to triger the cancel button on pressing the "escape" key (default: true). Depends on the 'allowCancel' property.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: A reference to the widget that previously had the focus

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Show the widget. Overriding methods must call this parent method. Returns the widget instance for chaining.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Hide the widget. Overriding methods must call this parent method. Returns the widget instance for chaining.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create the content of the qxl.dialog. Extending classes must implement this method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the default container (VBox)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the button pane (HBox)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create an OK button

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create a cancel button, which is hidden by default and will be shown if allowCancel property is set to true.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Called when the 'image' property is set

@param.name: @param
@param.description: The current value

@param.name: @param
@param.description: old The previous value

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Called when the 'message' property is set

@param.name: @param
@param.description: The current value

@param.name: @param
@param.description: old The previous value

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the widgets that is the container of the dialog

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Promise interface method, avoids callbacks

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Promise} A promise that resolves with the result of the dialog
 action
@return.description:
A promise that resolves with the result of the dialog
 action

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handle click on ok button. Calls callback with a "true" argument

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handle click on cancel button. Calls callback with an "undefined" argument

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handles the press on the 'Escape' key

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property callback. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #callback}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property callback. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #callback}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property callback. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #callback}.
